p: During the study, a total of 125 conjunctival swabs were collected from patients who attended ophthalmology clinics with symptoms of conjunctivitis. Of 125 specimens, 118 (94.5%) were positive for adenovirus and two (1.6%) for HSV1. There were no specimens positive for HSV2, VZV, or C. trachomatis. In five specimens, none of the investigated pathogens was detected.
